xxl.core.collections.containers.io

Class BlockFileContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.collections.containers.AbstractContainer
      • xxl.core.collections.containers.io.BlockFileContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Container

    public class BlockFileContainer
extends AbstractContainer
    This class provides a container that is able to store blocks in a file. There are some constructors that create a new container and there are some other constructors that open an existing container. All functionality concerning files can be exchanged by passing different factory methods to the constructors (important for the usage of own filesystems).

    The container depends on five files: a container file, a meta file, a reservedBitMap file, a updatedBitMap file and a freeList file.
    The container file is used for storing the blocks of this container. In addition, the offset of an block in the container file determines the id of the block in this container. Every block stored in the container file takes blockSize bytes, therefore blocks that contains more than blockSize bytes cannot be stored in this container. The metaData file contains the blockSize and the number of reserved blocks. The reservedBitMap file is a fat file of this container. It stores for each block whether it is already in use, i.e. cannot be reserved. In order to store this table, eight bits are joined to an int value. For this reason the nth bit of this file is stored as the (n%8) th bit of the (n/8) th byte value of this file. The name of this file is determined by the String prefix and the file extension .rbm. Similar to the reservedBitMap file, the updatedBitMap file stores for each block whether an update has been performed so that it is possible to get the block. The freeList file stores the offsets of removed blocks. Whenever a block should be written to this container, the freeList file is checked, whether there are empty blocks in the container file. If the freeList file contains offsets of removed blocks the new block will be stored in an empty space of the container file, else the container file will be enlarged.

    Earlier versions of xxl worked with only three files. Such Containers are automatically migrated to the five files version (at the first use).

    Example usage (1). 

         // create a new block file container with ...

     BlockFileContainer container = new BlockFileContainer(

         // files having the file name "BlockFileContainer"

         "BlockFileContainer",

         // a block size of 4 bytes (size of a serialized integer)

         4
     );

     // insert 10 blocks containing the integers between 0 and 9

     for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {

         // create a new block

         Block block = new Block(4);

         // catch IOExceptions

         try {

             // write the value of i to the block

             block.dataOutputStream().write(i);
         }
         catch (IOException ioe) {
             System.out.println("An I/O error occured.");
         }

         // insert the block into the block file container

         container.insert(block);
     }

     // get the ids of all elements in the container

     Iterator iterator = container.ids();

     // print all elements of the container

     while (iterator.hasNext()) {

         // get the block from the container

         Block block = (Block)container.get(iterator.next());

         // catch IOExceptions

         try {

             // print the data of the block

             System.out.println(block.dataInputStream().read());
         }
         catch (IOException ioe) {
             System.out.println("An I/O error occured.");
         }
     }

     // close the open container and clear its file after use

     container.close();
     container.clear();
     container.delete();
    See Also:
    Container, IOException, Iterator, NoSuchElementException, RandomAccessFile, WrappingRuntimeException

    • Field Detail

      • prefix

        protected String prefix
        The name for the files of this container. The file names of the five files a block file container consists of differ only in their file extensions.

        Contains operations for opening, creating, renaming and deleting files.

      • container

        protected RandomAccessFile container
        The container file of this container. The container file is used for storing the blocks of this container. In addition, the offset of an block in the container file determines the id of the block in this container. The name of the container file is determined by the String prefix and the file extension .ctr.

      • metaData

        protected RandomAccessFile metaData
        The metaData file contains the blockSize and the number of reserved blocks. The name of the container file is determined by the String prefix and the file extension .mtd.

      • reservedBitMap

        protected RandomAccessFile reservedBitMap
        A fat file of this container. The reservedBitMap file stores a bit table that shows for each block whether it can be reserved (false) or not (true). In order to store this table, eight bits are joined to an int value. For this reason the nth bit of this file is stored as the (n%8)th bit of the (n/8) th byte value of this file. The name of this file is determined by the String prefix and the file extension .rbm.

      • updatedBitMap

        protected RandomAccessFile updatedBitMap
        A fat file of this container. The updatedBitMap file stores a bit table that shows for each block whether it can be get (true) or not (false). In order to store this table, eight bits are joined to an int value. For this reason the nth bit of this file is stored as the (n%8)th bit of the (n/8) th byte value of this file. The name of this file is determined by the String prefix and the file extension .ubm.

      • freeList

        protected RandomAccessFile freeList
        The freeList file of this container. The freeList file stores the offsets of removed blocks. Whenever a block should be written to this container, the freeList file is checked, whether there are empty blocks in the container file. If the freeList file contains offsets of removed blocks the new block will be stored in an empty space of the container file, else the container file will be enlarged. The name of the freeList file is determined by the String prefix and the file extension .flt.

      • blockSize

        protected int blockSize
        The size reserved for storing a block in this container. Every block stored in the container file takes blockSize bytes, therefore blocks that contains more than blockSize bytes cannot be stored in this container.

      • size

        protected int size
        The number of blocks stored in this container.

      • idType

        protected byte idType
        Determines the type of the identifyers which are produced: 1: Byte, 2: Short, 3: Integer, 4: Long (default).

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlockFileContainer

        public BlockFileContainer(String prefix,
                          int blockSize,
                          FilesystemOperations fso)
        Constructs an empty BlockFileContainer that is able to store blocks with a maximum size of blockSize bytes. The given String prefix specifies the names of the files the are used for storing the elements of the container. When using existing files to store the container their data will be overwritten.

        This constructor is useful if you want to keep your file in a special self developed filesystem.

        Parameters:
        prefix - specifies the names of the files the container consists of.
        blockSize - the size reserved for storing a block in the container file.
        fso - Provides an object which performs the operations on the filesystem.

      • BlockFileContainer

        public BlockFileContainer(String prefix,
                          int blockSize)
        Constructs an empty BlockFileContainer that is able to store blocks with a maximum size of blockSize bytes. The given String prefix specifies the names of the files the are used for storing the elements of the container. When using existing files to store the container their data will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        prefix - specifies the names of the files the container consists of.
        blockSize - the size reserved for storing a block in the container file.

      • BlockFileContainer

        public BlockFileContainer(String prefix,
                          FilesystemOperations fso)
        Constructs a BlockFileContainer that consists of existing files given by the specified file name. Every information the container needs will be taken from the meta file.
        Parameters:
        prefix - specifies the names of the files the container consists of.
        fso - Provides an object which performs the operations on the filesystem.

      • BlockFileContainer

        Constructs a BlockFileContainer that consists of existing files given by the specified file name. Every information the container needs will be taken from the meta file.
        Parameters:
        prefix - specifies the names of the files the container consists of.

      • openFiles

        protected void openFiles()
        Opens the five container files using the given Factory.

      • migrateOnDemand

        protected void migrateOnDemand()
        Always called when opening a BlockFileContainer. This method checks whether the file structure is according to an old xxl-release. On demand, the file structure will be migrated automatically. Afterwards, it is impossible with an old xxl-release to work on the new file structure.

      • open

        protected void open()
        Opens the files of this container and restores the state of this container. This method expects the serialized state of the container at the end of the fat file. After restoring the state of the container, the serialized data is removed from the fat file.

      • objectIdConverter

        public FixedSizeConverter objectIdConverter()
        Returns a converter for the ids generated by this container. A converter transforms an object to its byte representation and vice versa - also known as serialization in Java.
        Because of using the offset in the container file (long value) as id, this method always returns a LongConverter.
        Specified by:
        objectIdConverter in interface Container
        Specified by:
        objectIdConverter in class AbstractContainer
        Returns:
        a converter for serializing the identifiers of the container.

      • getIdSize

        public int getIdSize()
        Returns the size of the ids generated by this container in bytes, which is 8.
        Specified by:
        getIdSize in interface Container
        Overrides:
        getIdSize in class AbstractContainer
        Returns:
        8

      • blockSize

        public int blockSize()
        Returns the size reserved for storing a block in this container. Every block stored in the container file takes blockSize bytes, therefore blocks that contains more than blockSize bytes cannot be stored in this container.
        Returns:
        the size reserved for storing a block in this container.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this container and any files associated with it.
        This implementation sets the length of the associated files to 0. Thereafter the size and maximum offset of this container are corrected.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all elements from the Container. After a call of this method, size() will return 0.
        This implementation only calls the reset() method.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface Container
        Overrides:
        clear in class AbstractContainer

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the Container and releases its associated files. But before closing the meta file, the serialized state of this container must be appended. Therefore, the values of the fields size and blockSize are append to the meta file. A closed container can be implicitly reopened by a consecutive call to one of its methods.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Container
        Overrides:
        close in class AbstractContainer

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Object id)
        Returns true if the container contains a block for the identifier id.
        This implementation checks whether the updatedBitMap files contains an entry for the offset specified by id.
        Specified by:
        contains in interface Container
        Overrides:
        contains in class AbstractContainer
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the block.
        Returns:
        true if the container has updated a block for the specified identifier.

      • get

        public Object get(Object id,
                  boolean unfix)
           throws NoSuchElementException
        Returns the block associated to the identifier id. An exception is thrown when the desired block is not found via contains. In this implementation the parameter unfix has no function because the container is unbuffered.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Container
        Specified by:
        get in class AbstractContainer
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the block.
        unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Returns:
        the block associated to the specified identifier.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the desired block is not found.

      • ids

        public Iterator ids()
        Returns an iterator that delivers all the identifiers of the container that are in use.
        Specified by:
        ids in interface Container
        Specified by:
        ids in class AbstractContainer
        Returns:
        an iterator of all identifiers used by this container.

      • isUsed

        public boolean isUsed(Object id)
        Checks whether the id has been returned previously by a call to insert or reserve and hasn't been removed so far. This implementation checks whether the reservedBitMap files contains an entry for the offset specified by id.
        Specified by:
        isUsed in interface Container
        Specified by:
        isUsed in class AbstractContainer
        Parameters:
        id - the id to be checked.
        Returns:
        true exactly if the id is still in use.

      • remove

        public void remove(Object id)
            throws NoSuchElementException
        Removes the block with identifier id. An exception is thrown when a block with an identifier id is not in the container. After a call of remove() all the iterators (and cursors) can be in an invalid state.
        This implementation clears the entry for the block in both fat files and adds id to the freeList file.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Container
        Specified by:
        remove in class AbstractContainer
        Parameters:
        id - an identifier of a block.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if a block with an identifier id is not in the container.

      • reserve

        public Object reserve(Function getObject)
        Reserves an id for subsequent use. This implementation sets in the reservedBitMap file the appropriate bit for the id returned by this method.
        Specified by:
        reserve in interface Container
        Specified by:
        reserve in class AbstractContainer
        Parameters:
        getObject - A parameterless function providing the object for that an id should be reserved. Not used by this implementation.
        Returns:
        the reserved id.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of elements of the container. In other words, the number of set bits in the updatedBitMap file.
        Specified by:
        size in interface Container
        Specified by:
        size in class AbstractContainer
        Returns:
        the number of elements.

      • update

        public void update(Object id,
                   Object object,
                   boolean unfix)
            throws NoSuchElementException
        Overwrites an existing (id,*)-element by (id, object). This method throws an exception if a block with an identifier id does not exist in the container (checked via isUsed). The parameter unfix has no function because this container is unbuffered.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Container
        Specified by:
        update in class AbstractContainer
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the element.
        object - the new block that should be associated to id.
        unfix - signals a buffered container whether the block can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if a block with an identifier id does not exist in the container.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Deletes the container. If necessary, the container is closed before.
